text: In the year ending March 2018, 30.0% of people aged 16 and over in the UK reported a very high rating of satisfaction with their lives overall (9 and 10 out of 10). No change over the short term (30.0% in the year ending March 2017) and an improvement over the long-term (26.0% in the year ending March 2013).

In the year ending March 2018, 35.8% of people in the UK aged 16 and over reported a very high rating that the things they do were worthwhile (9 and 10 out of 10). A slight improvement over the short term (35.1% in the year ending March 2017) and an improvement over the long-term (31.4% in the year ending March 2013).

In the year ending March 2018, 34.9% of people aged 16 and over in the UK reported their happiness yesterday as very high (9 and 10 out of 10). No change over the short term (34.9% in the year ending March 2017) and an improvement over the long-term (31.1% in the year ending March 2013).

unit_pre: Change from financial year ending 2016 to 2017
text: In the year ending March 2018, 40.5% of people aged 16 and over in the UK rated their anxiety as very low (0 to 1 out of 10). No change over the short term (40.2% in the year ending March 2017) and an improvement over the long-term (38.1% in the year ending March 2013).
